# raw tuned dept_trend_data gives 1612.455
# dept_trend_data <<- list(c(1, 0.99), c(2,  1.00), c(3,  1.00), c(4,  1.00),
#                         c(5,  0.90), c(6,  0.76), c(7,  0.97), c(8,  1.00),
#                         c(9,  1.02), c(10, 1.00), c(11, 0.95), c(12, 0.96),
#                         c(13, 0.98), c(14, 1.00), c(16, 0.93), c(17, 0.96),
#                         c(18, 0.97), c(19, 0.84), c(20, 0.98), c(21, 0.91),
#                         c(22, 1.00), c(23, 1.01), c(24, 0.97), c(25, 0.98),
#                         c(26, 0.94), c(27, 1.00), c(28, 0.87), c(29, 0.99),
#                         c(30, 0.91), c(31, 0.92), c(32, 0.96), c(33, 0.95),
#                         c(34, 0.98), c(35, 0.97), c(36, 0.93), c(37, 0.95),
#                         c(38, 1.00), c(40, 1.00), c(41, 0.90), c(42, 1.03),
#                         c(44, 1.00), c(45, 1.00), c(46, 1.02), c(48, 1.10), # 46 is critical
#                         c(49, 1.00), c(50, 0.95), c(52, 0.92), c(54, 0.20),
#                         c(55, 0.87), c(56, 0.92), c(58, 0.80), c(59, 0.44),
#                         c(60, 0.92), c(65, 0.85), c(67, 0.99), c(71, 0.97),
#                         c(72, 0.96), c(74, 0.98), c(79, 0.99), c(80, 1.00),
#                         c(81, 1.00), c(82, 1.07), c(83, 0.96), c(85, 0.87),
#                         c(87, 1.15), c(90, 1.04), c(91, 0.99), c(92, 1.05), # 87,90,91,92 are critical
#                         c(93, 1.05), c(94, 1.00), c(95, 1.00), c(96, 1.03), # most depts over 87 are important
#                         c(97, 1.00), c(98, 0.97), c(99, 0.10))
